document.title: Washington State K-12 World Languages Learning Standards

1EDC32F812354321B5F96A8F5460EA34.description:
Lifelong Learning: Learners set goals and reflect on their progress in using languages for enjoyment,
enrichment, and advancement.

52FF1C4A84A54434AB0EA19BCDB357F8.description:
School and Global Communities: Learners use the language both within and beyond the classroom
to interact and collaborate in their community and the globalized world.

4E8589EF56DF4AB48BC2996D8F00DA33.description:
Communities: Communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in multilingual communities at home
and around the world

A60B54600A664B8AAE084178374E176A.description:
Cultural Comparisons: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the concept of
culture through comparisons of the cultures studied and their own.

72F16E4E1FE24DF396D4EBA5CBF75C67.description:
Language Comparisons: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the nature
of language through comparisons of the language studied and their own.

54EED1C0B6314F88BB1737ACCC69640A.description: Comparisons: Develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with cultural competence

1CF053893418497D8050144999A3DD2D.description:
Acquiring Information and Diverse Perspectives: Learners access and evaluate information and
diverse perspectives that are available through the language and its cultures.

89926E66E1174A11B7EB2FAAFA101D15.description:
Making Connections: Learners build, reinforce, and expand their
knowledge of other disciplines while using the language to develop critical
thinking and to solve problems creatively.

1E038098E5B1427F94273D85E1D80F04.description:
Connections: Connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives
in order to use the language to function in academic and career-related situations

1028809C1839495EA844F2E8C9704089.description:
Relating Cultural Products to Perspectives: Learners use the language to investigate,
explain, and reflect on the relationship between the products and perspectives of the cultures studied.

38259472CAC04B88A95BE8E12E498ED4.description:
Relating Cultural Practices to Perspectives: Learners use the language to investigate,
explain, and reflect on the relationship between the practices and perspectives of the cultures
studied.

3780E00B18444C0DA4D51FE730E96A3A.description: Cultures: Interact with cultural competence and understanding

FF84E2A6234A4C2D9229A7302314CF56.description:
Presentational Communication: Learners present information, concepts, and
ideas to inform, explain, persuade, and narrate on a variety of topics using appropriate media and
adapting to various audiences of listeners, readers, or viewers.

78ACB14F0FA046DF850ED3BBC8F1601A.description:
Interpretive Communication: Learners understand, interpret, and analyze
what is heard, read, or viewed on a variety of topics.

9A81BE292A374093AD65BE53518F0172.description:
Interpersonal Communication: Learners interact and negotiate meaning
in spoken, signed, or written conversations to share information, reactions,
feelings, and opinions.

128AF443F9894B95B61C99F221144D90.description:
Communication: Communicate effectively in more than one language in order to function in a variety of situations and for multiple
purposes
